      • Close

        public void Close()
        Closes a store previously opened with System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.GetStore(System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageScope,System.Type,System.Type), System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.GetUserStoreForAssembly(), or System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.GetUserStoreForDomain().

        public IsolatedStorageFileStream CreateFile(java.lang.String path)
        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:

      • DeleteFile

        public void DeleteFile(java.lang.String file)
        Deletes a file in the isolated store.
        Parameters:
        file - The relative path of the file to delete within the isolated store.
        Throws:
        IsolatedStorageException - The store has been removed.-or-Unable to delete the file. -or-Isolated storage is disabled.
        ArgumentException - file is badly formed.
        ArgumentNullException - file is null.
        ObjectDisposedException - The store has been disposed.

      • FileExists

        public boolean FileExists(java.lang.String path)
        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:

      • CopyFile

        public void CopyFile(java.lang.String sourceFileName,
            java.lang.String destinationFileName,
            boolean overwrite)
        Copies an existing file to a new file, and optionally overwrites an existing file.
        Parameters:
        sourceFileName - The name of the file to copy.
        destinationFileName - The name of the destination file. This cannot be a directory.
        overwrite - true if the destination file can be overwritten; otherwise, false.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - sourceFileName or destinationFileName is a zero-length string, contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters defined by the System.IO.Path.GetInvalidPathChars() method.
        ArgumentNullException - sourceFileName or destinationFileName is null.
        InvalidOperationException - The isolated store has been closed.

      • GetUserStoreForApplication

        public static IsolatedStorageFile GetUserStoreForApplication()
        Obtains user-scoped isolated storage corresponding to the calling code's application identity.
        Returns:
        An System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile object corresponding to the isolated storage scope based on the calling code's assembly identity.

      • MoveDirectory

        public void MoveDirectory(java.lang.String sourceDirectoryName,
                 java.lang.String destinationDirectoryName)
        Moves a specified directory and its contents to a new location.
        Parameters:
        sourceDirectoryName - The name of the directory to move.
        destinationDirectoryName - The path to the new location for sourceDirectoryName. This cannot be the path to an existing directory.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - sourceFileName or destinationFileName is a zero-length string, contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters defined by the System.IO.Path.GetInvalidPathChars() method.
        ArgumentNullException - sourceFileName or destinationFileName is null.
        InvalidOperationException - The isolated store has been closed.
        ObjectDisposedException - The isolated store has been disposed.
        System.DirectoryNotFoundException - sourceDirectoryName does not exist.

      • MoveFile

        public void MoveFile(java.lang.String sourceFileName,
            java.lang.String destinationFileName)
        Moves a specified file to a new location, and optionally lets you specify a new file name.
        Parameters:
        sourceFileName - The name of the file to move.
        destinationFileName - The path to the new location for the file. If a file name is included, the moved file will have that name.

      • OpenFile

        public IsolatedStorageFileStream OpenFile(java.lang.String path,
                                 FileMode mode)
        Parameters:
        path -
        mode -
        Returns:

      • Remove

        public void Remove()
        Removes the isolated storage scope and all its contents.
        Throws:
        IsolatedStorageException - The isolated store cannot be deleted.
